results.title: [Evaluation of the antihypertensive efficacy of lisinopril and captopril associated with hydrochlorothiazide by ambulatory measurement of arterial pressure].
results.text_hl: The objective of this study was to evaluate the efficacy, particularly in terms of the 24-hour cover, and the safety of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ 20 mg + @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ 12.5 mg 5L/@CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@HCTZ@@@) and @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@ 50 mg + @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ 25 mg (@CHEMICAL_Carbon @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002244 @@@C@@@/@CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@HCTZ@@@) in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Essential_Tremor</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020329 @@@essential@@@ @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@HT@@@ requiring two-agent therapy.

citations.NLM: Vaïsse B, Renucci JF, Delage Y, Madonna O, Gressin V, Poggi L. [Evaluation of the antihypertensive efficacy of lisinopril and captopril associated with hydrochlorothiazide by ambulatory measurement of arterial pressure]. Ann Cardiol Angeiol (Paris). 1993 Dec;42(10):566-72. PMID: 8117053
